intro: Galeopsis flavescens, commonly known as yellow hedge nettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from June to August. Its stems are often reddish and covered with fine hairs, while the leaves are usually pubescent. Galeopsis flavescens is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
